website_summaries.verdict: True to its claim, the Keen Grayson Chukka is a lightweight sneaker-boot that has a versatile style. It can be dressed up and down, depending on the user’s need. This shoe also received a lot of positive feedback for being comfortable, thanks to its cushioned footbed and soft leather upper.
pros: The Keen Grayson Chukka is an exceptionally comfortable sneaker-boot, based on several commenters
Majority of buyers are happy about the durability of this shoe
Many users find this shoe to be very good looking
Some wearers can attest that the Keen Grayson is light on the foot
The midsole support given by this shoe is appreciated by several reviewers
A lot of people commend the stylish design of the Keen men’s Grayson Chukka
Several sneakerheads like the cushioned footbed of this kick
A good number of reviewers mention that this shoe looks good when worn with either business casual slacks or rugged jeans
A few reviews mention that the leather used on this shoe is very soft
cons: Most wearers are disappointed that it felt narrower compared to other Keen shoe models
This shoe feels stiff at first and needs a bit of break-in time, based on some reviews
Some complain about getting blisters in the heel area after wearing the Keen Grayson Chukka

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Just received these today and I am already sending them back.I have had several pairs of Keens in the past but these are nowhere near the quality of my past Keens. Firstly the soles look like they were molded of the cheapest possible material and just have a shiny plastic like look. The top layer of material around the ankles is too small and I could tell they after a few hours of wear would irritate and eventually cause blisters. Finally the color...the description says Brown and in the picture they are clearly brown but in person they have a very green cast. Sadly I think I'm done with Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum

customer_reviews.title: The Grayson shoes by Keen are poorly designed and is poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I am disapointed in the Grayson shoes. The fit is odd and the stitching on the tongue irritates the little toe. The tongue is made using two pieces of leather and this seems to be thicker on the same shoe in the same area. I have worn them for over a week and the shoes are broken in and still no change. I have a pair of Austin shoes that are made better than these and the fit is perfect. I have gone back to wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Anita G.

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 Months and in the middle of Covid and the stitching is gone.
customer_reviews.text: The stitching is blown out on one of the shoes. No major wear on the shoes and just over 2 months old. The last pair of boots I had lasted me over 5 years and I only replaced them because the soles were flat at this point. I have purchased 5 or 6 pairs of Keen boots and sandals through the years, and this is the first time that I have had an issue like this with their products. I have submitted a warranty claim with the company and I hope they make good on the product. But until then, I will let you know that the quality is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor ankle support/foot support
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen shoes in general but this style is poorly designed as their is no way to tighten the boot correctly across the top of your foot and ankle. They are OK for wearing around the office but are not good for any kind of serious walking.
customer_reviews.author: John Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but little tolerance for imperfect feet.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, unfortunately not compatible with my feet. The quality meets usual Keen standards, and the design is very nice, but I had problem just trying to get them on. I've purchased many keen shoes in the past, as it's my go-to brand, but these shoes have a very narrow tolerance for my wide feet, and my somehow high bridge. They were tight in all the wrong places.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Oros

customer_reviews.title: Soles wore out in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the look of these shoes, and they became quite comfortable as I wore them in. However, after only 4 or 5 months they began to develop holes in the toe and ball area of the soles. I work a desk job and didn't do a ton of walking in these, nor did I wear them every day. Keen refused to repair or replace them under warranty. I paid a lot of money for a shoe that didn't even last half a year.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and comfortable. The leather is a bit thin and I would prefer a polishable leather finish but otherwise these are great. They are capable enough that I can use them for light hiking and working outdoors but look good enough to wear to work.
customer_reviews.author: N. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoe looks good so far, but the insoles are missing. There is no cushioning at all inside.
customer_reviews.author: raymond hickman

customer_reviews.title: Good looking boot
customer_reviews.text: well made and fit is perfect, wish for more aggressive arch support though
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: Made for geisha feet
customer_reviews.text: Made for geisha feet. If you have bound or disfigured feet, they’ll fit. Otherwise find a different shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Watson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and good looking.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and good looking. Lightweight also. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Lennartsell

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide Keen shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought due to Keen being a wider than normal shoe even if not advertised as such. Found that to be true - I require a wider than normal shoe and these fit just perfect - not too tight in any areas.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Size runs large.
customer_reviews.text: I used the provided size chart and end up ordering a size 13 boot for my 29 cm foot. I usually wear size 12 but decided to go with the size chart data. No surprise when i got the boot it was too large for my foot. I'm not state side so returning is out of the option sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Travis K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably my 6th pair of Keens' over the years and are always top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love them!. The fit was perfect, nice wide toe box and i have friends already asking me where i bought them, want to order them
customer_reviews.author: dan brady

customer_reviews.title: Nice leather but toe area is too big for the shoe style, not a typical Keen.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice looking shoes but they do have an oddly large toe area. They look slightly clown like and that was not what I was going for. I am a big fan of Keen and like everything I have bought from them. These I returned because of the above mentioned comments.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brink

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Grayson Chukka-M Hiking Shoe, Mid Brown/Scylum
